centralQuestion: Should the US fund the development of open source AI models?

reasons.description: Strengthens U.S. competitiveness and strategic autonomy (including defense use-cases) while reducing vendor lock-in.

sources.title: CSIS 'Defense Priorities in the Open-Source AI Debate'
Council on Foreign Relations: 'The Interconnect: What to Know About the New U.S. AI Diffusion Policy and Export Controls'
PBS NewsHour (AP): 'White House says no need to restrict open-source AI, for now'

reasons.description: Expands innovation capacity by lowering costs and barriers for startups, universities, and public agencies.

sources.title: New America: 'Openness in Artificial Intelligence Models: A Key to Ensuring AI Serves Democratic Values and the Public Interest'
CSIS: 'Defense Priorities in the Open-Source AI Debate' (on supplier diversity and avoiding lock-in)
AP News: 'White House says no need to restrict 'open-source' artificial intelligence for now'

reasons.description: Improves transparency, reproducibility, and safety research by enabling broader auditing, red-teaming, and community scrutiny.

sources.title: New America: 'Openness in Artificial Intelligence Models: A Key to Ensuring AI Serves Democratic Values and the Public Interest'
RAND Corporation: 'Labelling initiatives, codes of conduct and other self-regulatory mechanisms for artificial intelligence applications'
CSIS: 'Defense Priorities in the Open-Source AI Debate' (on advantages of public inspection and red-teaming)

reasons.description: Builds public-interest infrastructure and democratic oversight over foundational technologies that shape knowledge and culture.

sources.title: The Guardian (Opinion): 'Large language models that power AI should be publicly owned'
New America: 'Openness in Artificial Intelligence Models: A Key to Ensuring AI Serves Democratic Values and the Public Interest'

objections.description: Open release of model weights can increase misuse risks (e.g., cyber, bio, disinformation) and diffusion to adversaries.

sources.title: Council on Foreign Relations: 'The Interconnect: What to Know About the New U.S. AI Diffusion Policy and Export Controls' (notes open-weight risks)
AP News: 'In first AI dialogue, US cites 'misuse' of AI by China, Beijing hits back'

objections.description: Hard to regulate consistently; open-source exceptions and definitional gaps can create enforcement and liability challenges.

sources.title: Council on Foreign Relations: 'The Interconnect: What to Know About the New U.S. AI Diffusion Policy and Export Controls'
PBS NewsHour (AP): 'Regulators turn to math to determine when AI is powerful enough to be dangerous'

objections.description: Net benefits are uncertain; policymakers caution against premature mandates or blanket funding without clearer risk–benefit evidence.

sources.title: CSIS: 'Defense Priorities in the Open-Source AI Debate' (notes inconclusive evidence and need for further assessment)
RAND Corporation: 'Labelling initiatives, codes of conduct and other self-regulatory mechanisms for AI applications' (emphasizes structured governance tools)

objections.description: Open models may inadvertently accelerate competitors’ capabilities, complicating U.S. export-control and national-security goals.

sources.title: Council on Foreign Relations: 'The Interconnect: What to Know About the New U.S. AI Diffusion Policy and Export Controls'
AP News: 'What is DeepSeek, the Chinese AI company upending markets and AI competition?'

research.title: Ethical-Lens: Curbing malicious usages of open-source text-to-image models
research.description: Peer-reviewed study proposing an ethics-guided framework and mitigations aimed specifically at misuse risks of open-source generative models.

research.title: On the transparency of large AI models
research.description: Peer-reviewed article arguing for greater transparency across model lifecycle elements (data, code, weights) to improve accountability and reproducibility.

research.title: Open data and code to advance robust machine learning research
research.description: Peer-reviewed analysis advocating open data/code practices to enhance robustness, replicability, and scientific progress in ML.

research.title: Open-source models for development of data and metadata standards
research.description: Peer-reviewed article detailing how open-source model ecosystems help standardize data/metadata practices and accelerate scientific collaboration.
